profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T21:17-0400

did.physdesc: 11 sound tape reels (16 hr., 50 min.) : analog, 1 7/8 ips, half track, mono ; 5 in.
did.abstract: Field recordings made in various locations in southeastern Oaxaca, Mexico in the summer of 1967 by Paul R. Turner with numerous Highland Chontal speakers. Elicitations of Highland Chontal words and phrases, using a common Spanish word list for all consultants.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials
relatedmaterial.p: A project report accompanying these recordings can be found in Phillips Fund Collection (Mss.497.3.Am4).

odd.head: General note
odd.p: This collection was originally recorded on 23 3-1/2 sound tape reels of 300 ft. each that were transferred to 5-inch reels for storage. Each 5-inch reel contains two of the collector's original reels.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Paul R. Turner in 1968 (Acc. 1968 469r). This material was recorded with the assistance of a Phillips Rund grant.
